name: flipper_the_dolphin_bitch
text: A comment left by flipper_the_dolphin_bitch was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ohmygooses, speth, scraggg)

name: c_dizzle
text: Yeah...this will be my only comment on this arc. I know now that I'm just going to have to let it seep in slowly. So it begins....(for me)...

name: mugi
text: Same; I've heard so much about this arc.  The suspense is killing me.

name: poodlelucy
text: same.

name: soticoto
text: Fvck yeah!?

name: jlynes
text: Little-known quote from Cicero on the occasion of his election to Consul.

name: soticoto
text:
I ruined it with my old habit of vowel-substitution, didn't I?

*facepalm*

name: flynn
text: Two of Beef's best lines ever in a single strip.

name: saint
text: I've never seen Beef so badass in all of achewood.

name: zeal
text: Beef is raw here in ways that Ray can scarcely comprehend, much less emulate.

name: dougthehead
text: Yeah, and I just realized that Beef probably did this so that the fight organizers wouldn't realize that there were 3001 men inside the Acres.  Dang, I've read this arc like thirty times and I never realized until now that he did that for reasons other than building a brand.

name: thesoulbear
text: This was an excellent thing to notice.

name: spinynorman
text:
I love the Nate Small callback.

Nate Small: One Tough Man - "Trouble on Snake Island"

name: bazookaradio
text:
Make 'em tall and ice cold, just like yours truly.

100% BAD ASS.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: I'm willing to bet that, before the year is out, Wikipedia will attribute the founding of Coca-Cola to Frederick H. Coca-Cola.

name: senseihollywood
text: as has been proven

name: kickstart
text: He's one of the greats, right up there with Jack Chevrolet and Bill Pontiac.

name: layzerblade
text: Ryan IKEA.

name: atypicaloracle
text: Sven IKEA, dude. Everybody knows its Swedish.

name: anomalous3
text: Wow. Most badass beef line ever.

name: craigola
text: I thought I knew what Beef was capable of, until I saw this strip.

name: epicurus
text: Beef is totally raw.

name: soticoto
text: Beef basically has wicked sack.

name: tombsgrave
text: I like a good Polish.

name: paco
text: A comment left by paco was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by divot, srmeowmeow, Jesler729, _cheesekayke, Semiquaver, scraggg, valrus)

name: wae
text: having now read through the engagement arc, i see that onstad set out early to make a man of beef. or at least a Grown Cat.

name: patiently56
text: probably a good idea to dust off a couple polish before the bigh fight.

name: patiently56
text: *big

name: mattfish
text: pouf

name: stuart
text: What's up with those dudes in the background of the penultimate panel?

name: phthoggos
text: I believe you mean antepenultimate

name: stuart
text: ... yes

name: aaron_haynes
text: They are there to illustrate that Beef, while not being Frederick H. Coca-Cola, does know something about building a brand.

name: hoostro
text: Pouf. The sound of a badass

name: saint
text: towel, you truly are everywhere...how many profiles do you have on Achewood?

name: quantumcasaba
text:
I love that this goes from cold snapping a dude's leg to state-fair..
A polish, maybe some funnel cake. Chickens brukking in the background.

name: luckypyjamas
text: sheer unadulterated badassery

name: wulvaine
text:
This coming from a man named after auspicious sleepwear whose avatar is a dinosaur with a skateboard. Clearly an authority on the subject of badassery.

Damn... I forgot... No one should be a cock to a stranger, ever... Sorry about that.

And actually, a dinosaur with a skateboard IS pretty badass.

name: wulvaine
text: God, don't let me become towl...

name: luckypyjamas
text:
lucky pyjamas is actually the name of my fantasy racehorse

an underdog with a lot of spirit

lucky pyjamas won all the races, and more importantly, the hearts of millions

name: luckypyjamas
text: someday

name: wulvaine
text: That sounds like the name of a racehorse I would bet on. And I have never been to a horse race in my life.

name: luckypyjamas
text:
i'm hoping to attract a cult following and eventually a film deal

such as seabiscuit did

name: bixschmix
text: When I go to horse races, I choose my bets by the creativity by which the steeds are named. That is why I do not win. However, my grandfather can bet on his age and multiply his money like nobody's business. Is this fair? I think not.

name: luckypyjamas
text:
this same principle led me to bet on a horse named "backseat rhythm"

he sounded like a winner

name: tekende
text:
I've never understood horse names. Why are they always so weird? I saw this one racehorse named No Kelp Weed one time. I mean, what the hell?

That said, if I had a racehorse I would probably scour the novels of Thomas Pynchon until I could find a sentence that contains at least three wonderful words and makes no sense out of context, and then my horse would be named.

That or, like, Patton.

name: echidnaboy
text: Racehorses should be named after [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ships_%28The_Culture%29]Culture ships[/i].

name: echidnaboy
text: sigh .

name: luckypyjamas
text:
and here's prosthetic conscience overtaking irregular apocalypse, but wait, wait! lucky pyjamas pulls ahead for the victory! ladies and gentlemen, we have a winner!

lucky pyjamas is the dark horse, if you will

name: luckypyjamas
text:
a thousand pardons

that was uncalled for

name: i_love_kate
text: You're barely giving any gravitas at all to these horses you're naming.

name: luckypyjamas
text: how much gravitas do they deserve?

name: echidnaboy
text:
Quote:
MattB242
Somebody once told me that the ships 'Very Little Gravitas Indeed' and 'Zero Gravitas' were a response to a scathing review. Is this true?

IainMBanks
Yes. But it was a scathing review of Culture ship-naming policy delivered by another Involved civilisation. They suggested that such enormously powerful and intellectually refined entities ought to have names with a little more gravitas, to reflect their near-god-like status; the immediate and sustained reaction of one of the Culture's ship manufacturies was to name all its subsequent vessels things like: Stood Far Back When The Gravitas Was Handed Out; Gravitas, What Gravitas?; Gravitas... Gravitas... No, Don't Help Me, I'll Get It In A Moment; Gravitas Free Zone; Low Gravitas Warning Signal, etc etc (including the Zen-like Absolutely No You-No-What). I am so sad I have a separate list of the Gravitas ships at home. It currently runs to about 20, I think.

name: i_love_kate
text: I thought it was the Idirans... But maybe that was a fabrication on my part.

name: redphillip
text:
Them poor horse owners. Naming is constrained kinds like actors in SAG -- you can't have a name any other horse has ever had. Some stables will have a 'brand' name, like Skyview Desert Wind, Skyview Daddy's Luck, etc. Racehorse owners/breeders are also hella superstitious, so names are sometimes tied up in their personal voodoo. There my be other more arcane rules I'm too lazy to research.

The perversity of the universe tends to a maximum.
(The 1st corollary to Murphy's Law)

name: tekende
text: Ahh, okay. Well, that makes slightly more sense. Thanks.

name: apocowarg
text: My grandfather's racehorses are named by combining the names or parts of the names of the parents. It can make for some odd combinations.

name: zapatos
text: Every indie rock band is named after a race horse.

name: luckypyjamas
text: this is undeniably true

name: darthemed
text: Man, Beef cold mowed that man down. Given the awesome conclusion of the Fight, it would really suck to be the guy who didn't even get into the yard.

name: gbeaton
text:
I want to give this comic a 6, and a massive chubby.

All innuendo explicitly implied.

name: goatmasterflash
text:
6 would be a massive chubby...for a cat.
that kind of innuendo?

name: baryonyx
text: Beef kicked a man in the groin with a motorbike.

name: bixschmix
text: That's OK, that part of the leg heals quickly.

name: dumase
text: Dusting off a couple of Polish lets people know whos in charge.

name: drago25
text: Polish is what a man destroys before a fight. And Beef is most certainly proving to be that.

name: tekende
text: The guys in the background of the third-to-last panel look pretty awesome.

name: dans
text: beef's mad depression has nothing on his badassery.

name: zapatos
text: They go hand in hand.  His high will make his next low so much lower.  It is science, of the brain.

name: mustakrakesh
text:
You can't hack a furious Nazi from San Bernardino you gotta put your fists up...

Truer words were never spoken

name: greyfield
text: Hell yeah. I've been to San Bernardino, and you don't want to cross their massive furlous Nazis.

name: perilon
text: In three and a half years I've still never figured out the physics necessary to sneak up on a previously-unseen man and run a wheel underneath only the leg which was resting below his other leg.   I'm not sayin' Beef can't do it, I'm only sayin'.

name: sarsbar
text: This is why Roast Beef is the greatest in the animal kingdom.
